content: I notice we've frequently not had a topic for the design meeting. Libs team has just proposed to start scheduling a meeting every 2 weeks the hour after the design meeting; since these are in the evening, it would be ideal for me if I could plan that I will have only 1 out of every 2 wednesday evenings booked for Rust meetings. What would people think about planning lang team design meetings to be biweekly, on the same day as libs meetings?
It seems to be feast or famine. When we have topics, we often have 2-4 topics and we want to queue them up.
And then the queue runs empty.
I can definitely appreciate the idea of trying to improve meeting scheduling though. Hmmm.
(I will note that we had discussed at triage that maybe the current slot is not ideal as well)
but maybe that's just for @Lokathor -- not sure
True, though in that case, someone mentioned that Monday was the only weekday they had.
(deleted)
I know I'm trying to move a biweekly conflict out of wednedsay right now
A conflict with the design meeting?
yeah
So, I know we said before that we don't want to schedule the triage and design meetings on the same day, or at the very least not back to back.
Personally, I would actually love to have them on the same day, as long as they weren't back to back. But I can appreciate that that might not work for everyone.
currently triage Monday works, but design Wednesday doesn't. I've got Sunday/Monday available
I know that the current time slot was picked on the basis of people's schedules who aren't necessarily attending.
maybe Josh or someone else on lang team can prepare a new doodle? that might be a good way of trying to work out if there's a better time
but i catch the videos of meetings i miss, and I'm pretty active here on zulip too
That you are. :smiley:
I can certainly run a new Doodle. Would like to get a flavor for people's preferences first. As well as who actually wants to attend.

My preference would be non-Wednesday/Thursday, but beyond that I'm generally flexible. I wouldn't mind a Monday slot -- having a "lang meeting" day would be nice in some sense. I think that's worked well for core's similar split fwiw
(core has design/triage meetings on wednesday right now)
@boats If lang were to reschedule its design meeting, would libs end up following suit? I would certainly like you (and others) to be able to consolidate meeting days.
I would love to do the same myself.
Do we have a topic for today's design meeting?
@Josh Triplett I think the slot libs is using was the only slot that was available for everyone. Personally I would really like if I could devote only 1.5 evenings a week to Rust meetings.
I am fine with scheduling every 2 weeks. I have also been thinking we need to change our method of scheduling.

Though I also like that with the lang triage meeting's current schedule, I my evening is free before 9pm. The current schedule is ideal for me except that I am more likely to skip a design meeting on the week libs doesn't have a meeting.
The compiler team has a dedicated scheduling slot every 4 weeks
where we schedule the next 3 weeks
I've found this... quite useful :)
I was hoping to pull it off more ad-hoc for lang but it doesn't seem to work
this is somewhat independent from changing the time/schedule

boats said:

Josh Triplett I think the slot libs is using was the only slot that was available for everyone. Personally I would really like if I could devote only 1.5 evenings a week to Rust meetings.

well to be fair this is based on me limiting my availability tuesday/thursday evenings based on the current lang schedule, so we could do a doodle and if there's a better time i could revisit the libs doodle and propose a new time also
I'm about to find out in the next week or so what the constraints on my schedule will be for the next six months. Any objections to us holding off on rescheduling until then?
Until then, I have no objection to going biweekly in the current slot.

Also:

Do we have a topic for today's design meeting?
@Josh Triplett backlog bonanza, see #t-lang > design meeting 2020-09-30

I had also been wondering if there was a better way we could try coordinate all the new Libs meetings. We also have project group ones happening on alternating weeks. If a better time comes up Iâ€™d be all for it!
